docblock.description: This file is part of the Sagres package.
The Locator class makes it easy to locate/specify files or folders in the FileSystem
Holds File Node and Link Node types
adds a single resource to the current list
ads a filesystem node abstraction to the current set
adds a folder resource to the list, optionally filtering out resources
docblock.long-description:
File Resources that do not match the $filter regular expression will not be included.

This function is not recursive, so files inside other folders will not be included

docblock.description: does the same than Locator::add() but recursive
resolves a path into a node object

tag.name: return

docblock.description: This file is part of the Sagres package.
The Stat class makes it easy to get Resource information
docblock.long-description: It wraps stat and lstat in a consistent object

docblock.description: here we tell the class what node to use to get information from

tag.name: param
tag.description: the node to get information from

docblock.description: returns the filesystem node in use
populates the class properties according to information gathered from the OS
docblock.long-description: links will be recognized and information will be relative to the link and not tho the resource they point to

docblock.description: gets the inode number **On windows is allways 0**
Owner user id **On windows is allways 0**
Owner group id **On windows is allways 0**
gets the device type if it is an inode device
gets the file size in the specified conversion rate
docblock.long-description:
defaul is returning in bytes but other values are available:

  • ::SIZE_B - size in bytes
  • ::SIZE_KB - size in kilobytes
  • ::SIZE_MB - size in megabytes

docblock.description: gets FS block size **On windows is allways -1 **
number of 512-byte blocks allocated **On windows is allways -1**
gets the username of the resource owner
gets the groupname of the resource
get resource permissions in Ocatal format (ex: 0777)
gets the resource permissions in a human readable way, unix style -rwxrwxrwx
gets the resource permissions according to the desired format
